programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook
programme.desc: Oysters, Crabs & Bananas: A local guide takes Jack island-hopping to find some of the world's most pristine oyster beds, where he tries to catch mud crabs and uses a chef's trick to do so.

programme.title: Jack Stein: Born to Cook
programme.desc: An Epic Beach Feast: Jack honours the people and food that he has encountered in Kimberley with a long-table dinner under the stars.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Vigilant Customs and Border Protection officers uncover 5,000 rounds of ammunition being smuggled across Hidalgo Bridge into Mexico.

programme.title: Border Force America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A new recruit fresh out of training school makes her mark when she uncovers 12kg of cocaine hidden in a car that she has stopped on one of the bridges.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Hollywood Honey Hole: The guys stumble on a hot Hollywood hoard when they meet a Golden Age stuntman whose garage is chock-full of mind-blowing memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Knucklehead Frank: Danielle sends the guys to look around a high-dollar collection in southern California where Frank meets a kindred spirit and international man of mystery.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Bentwaters: Fierce bidding wars abound as the hit reality show crosses the Atlantic. The contents of some old army bunkers could mean a big windfall. A vintage box rouses Rupert.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Perth: Auction experts compete for storage lots in the cut-throat reality show! The chance of winning a car in a blind auction drives Heavy D and the gang into a bidding frenzy.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Blackpool: Fast-talking auctioneer Sean Kelly brings his hugely popular show over the pond. The gang visit Blackpool, where Nat and John take a punt on a novel mode of transport.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Oxford: Same brilliant format, different accents! Storage Hunters comes to the UK. John goes against his wife and business partner's advice and ends up in a battle with Dan.

programme.title: James May's Man Lab
programme.desc: New. James May continues his quest to reskill the modern male by attempting to prove the impossible - that an Englishman can take a penalty and score - in front of 20,000 Germans.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: What's faster: a Ford Ka or a pigeon? James May provides the answer as Jezza tries to drive from London to Edinburgh and back in an Audi A8 on just one tank of fuel.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The lads rev it up when they race a BMW 6 Series, Porsche 911 and Jaguar XKR along Pendine Sands in Wales, and Johnny Vaughan and Denise Van Outen are reunited.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Sheep: The Bikers focus on sheep which have provided us with milk, meat and wool for thousands of years - dishes include mechoui lamb and a hogget and barley stew.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: Morocco and Turkey: As Rick's engaging guide to Mediterranean food reaches Morocco, he enjoys couscous, tucks into tagines and mint tea, and cooks the Moroccan dish of kefta mkaouara.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Dion Dublin, Debbie McGee, Bob Mortimer and Lucy Porter.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson return to the best-selling author's quizzing home for a champions' special.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Jennie McAlpine, rugby union star Ugo Monye, and comedians Joe Pasquale and Felicity Ward join Richard to see how good their general knowledge really is.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty is guest host as Baroness Ruth Davidson and actor and comedian Hugh Dennis join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Naked Truth: Sandi Toksvig uncovers the bare truth with Richard Osman, Lolly Adefope, Lee Mack and Alan Davies. Why is Alan weird? And what can't you do to a naked Osman?

programme.desc: The Proton Resurgence: Leonard and Sheldon hire Professor Proton, the host of a TV science show they watched as children, to come to their flat and entertain them.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Lobster, an Armadillo and a Way Bigger Number: Sheldon joins Dr Linkletter and Dr Sturgis on a science road trip, which lands them in the middle of nowhere.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Suitcase Full of Cash and a Yellow Clown Car: When Meemaw's gambling room is a success, she finds herself with a suitcase of illegal cash.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: It's time for the second Commitment Ceremony. Intimacy Week has strengthened some relationships but others have imploded. Adrian's in hot water.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wedding Gift Wormhole: A stressed Sheldon and Amy struggle to work out what the 'perfect gift' is that Leonard and Penny gave them on their wedding day.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Procreation Calculation: Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home to Howard and Bernadette's house. Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tam Turbulence: When Sheldon won't tell anyone why he's never mentioned Tam, his childhood best friend, Leonard tries to find out more.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Passion's Harvest and a Sheldocracy: Sheldon must choose sides in an ethical dilemma; Mary tries her hand at writing; Mandy needs a new place to live.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Blonde Ambition and the Concept of Zero: Sheldon makes a terrifying mathematical discovery. And Mary is jealous of Missy's relationship with Mandy and Meemaw.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: En Garde: The family supports Manny's new interest - fencing. It turns out he's pretty good at it, but Jay's proud enthusiasm triggers an old childhood wound for Mitchell.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Great Expectations: With a history of giving bad gifts, Claire is determined to surprise Phil with an amazing anniversary present - a private performance by Izzy LaFontaine.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Last Tap Dance in Springfield: Lisa takes up dancing but discovers that she's not very good at it. Bart and Milhouse duck out of their camping trip and hide out in the mall.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge: Otto's rock 'n' roll marriage to his girlfriend Becky (Parker Posey) is over as soon as it's begun. So Becky moves in with the Simpsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Laureate Accumulation: When their academic competitors charm America on a publicity tour, Sheldon and Amy try to get some Nobel laureates on their side.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Inspiration Deprivation: Amy has a meltdown when she feels the pressure of what it would mean for women everywhere if she were to win a Nobel Prize.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Decision Reverberation: Raj publishes a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Penny encourages Leonard to stand up for himself.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Itchy & Scratchy & Poochie Show: Homer gets a job on The Itchy & Scratchy Show as the voice of hip-hop surfer dog Poochie, a character brought in to boost viewing figures.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A plan is hatched to free Mercedes, and one resident's cries for help are heard. Meanwhile, not everyone is happy when an unexpected engagement merges two families.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: Sparks fly with new couple Beth and Teejay. And Jacqui's desire to teach Ryan how to be the husband that she wants has devastating consequences.

programme.title: New: Love Triangle UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: With some daters struggling to keep both of their partners happy, the gloves come off at the final dinner party, where unresolved issues explode spectacularly.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: What do the Goggleboxers think of The Graham Norton Show; Mary Berry - Love to Cook; Celebrity Antiques Road Trip; Strictly; The Lakes with Simon Reeve; and Sex: Unzipped?

programme.title: The Northman
programme.desc: (2022) Epic Viking saga starring Alexander Skarsgård as a warrior prince who goes on the rampage to Iceland to avenge his murdered father. With Ethan Hawke, Nicole Kidman and Björk.

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: (2011) Fantasy action-adventure. Jason Momoa stars as Conan, who sets out to kill the evil warlord who massacred his village when he was young. With Stephen Lang and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: (2017) Sci-fi horror. Is there life on Mars? Looks like Jake Gyllenhaal, Ryan Reynolds and Rebecca Ferguson have found some. Exciting, right? Well...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Zoo
programme.desc: (2017) Heart-warming family drama. During the Belfast Blitz, a young lad becomes the protector of a baby elephant. Can he and his friends save Buster from being put down?

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy adventure. Jack Black stars as the would-be travel writer Lemuel Gulliver, who gets stranded on an island of tiny people in this updating of Jonathan Swift's classic novel.

programme.title: Dream Horse
programme.desc: (2020) Uplifting fact-based comedy drama with Toni Collette and Damian Lewis. Welsh villagers club together to save up, buy a racehorse, and bring joy back to their town.

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: (2018) High-octane sci-fi action adventure starring Hailee Steinfeld. When Charlie drives home a clapped-out VW Beetle, she gets more than she bargained for: a huge robotic alien.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Stuber
programme.desc: (2019) Action-comedy starring Dave Bautista as a tough cop and Kumail Nanjiani as a mild-mannered Uber driver who he hires to tail a violent drug kingpin around LA.

programme.title: Beautiful Beings
programme.desc: (2022) Adults only drama tackling youth violence in Iceland. When charismatic, latently sensitive Addi welcomes bullied Balli into his gang, the question is why? In Icelandic/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Found
programme.desc: Documentary. Three deaf people talk about the day they discovered the deaf world, sign language and a new identity.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: (1954) Swashbuckling adventure. One of King Arthur's courtiers, the Viking Prince Valiant (Robert Wagner) uncovers the evil Sir Brack's (James Mason) plot to kill the king. Can he foil him?

programme.title: The Desert Rats
programme.desc: (1953) Second World War drama featuring Richard Burton as the commander of Australian troops during the 1941 siege of Tobruk. Also starring Robert Newton and James Mason.

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street
programme.desc: (1956) Thriller starring Van Johnson as a blind playwright who overhears a kidnapping plot and, with his fiancée (Vera Miles) and secretary (Cecil Parker), sets out to trap the villains.

programme.title: The Mountain Between Us
programme.desc: (2017) Action adventure. Can two strangers (Kate Winslet and Idris Elba) survive in extreme conditions after their charter plane crashes in the mountains?

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost...
programme.desc: ...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!

programme.title: My Friend Dahmer
programme.desc: (2017) Ross Lynch portrays serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer at high school in this biographical drama based on John 'Derf' Backderf's graphic novel.

programme.title: Submarine
programme.desc: (2011) Craig Roberts stars in Richard Ayoade's comedy-drama as a teen finding love while navigating the trials of school and home life. With Sally Hawkins and Yasmin Paige. Strong language.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Randolph Scott stars as a drifter who arrives in a small border town and tangles with a group of villains after helping a wealthy young Mexican, played by Manuel Rojas.

programme.title: Anne of the Indies
programme.desc: (1951) Jean Peters plays the title role of a brave buccaneer who falls for Captain LaRochelle (Louis Jourdan) without realising he has been planted in her crew to capture her.

programme.title: The Seventh Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1958) Fantasy adventure. When Sinbad's fiancée is shrunk by an evil magician, he must overcome a series of daunting adversaries and obstacles to restore her. Effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: (1958) Brooding western starring Joan Collins and Gregory Peck. A man hunts down the four escaped prisoners who he believes are responsible for the murder of his wife.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: (1994) Thriller with Harrison Ford. Can CIA agent Jack Ryan rescue US troops abandoned in Colombia, with only a renegade agent to help? Wouldn't bet against him. With Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: Rocketman
programme.desc: (2019) Taron Egerton is Elton John in Dexter Fletcher's sequins-and-all biopic musical drama. With Jamie Bell as lyricist Bernie Taupin and Stephen Graham as Dick James.

programme.title: Flight
programme.desc: (2012) Drama with Denzel Washington. A hard-drug-using airline pilot lands a plane in a heroically spectacular way. But a blood test reveals that he was high in more ways than one...

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Action thriller film starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pine, 2010. A veteran engineer and a young conductor race against the clock to prevent a catastrophe involving a train.

programme.title: Shop on TV
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Drop In For Brunch: American version of the reality television series. Each of the remaining contestants must create a brunch dish that incorporates both sweet and savoury elements.

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Your daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: This episode follows Paula Beer - a mother searching for the son she gave up as a teenager - and Sharon Thomas, a sister looking for the younger brother her mother had to give up.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is let loose on the streets of Portsmouth to spread some fun to unsuspecting members of the public who get the chance to win a host of possible prizes.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: The nation's most beloved talent competition continues with more top-quality acts performing for Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and guest judge KSI.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and enjoying recipes from chefs Asma Khan, Ashley Palmer-Watts, and Jonny Lake while cooking for former Wham! star Pepsi DeMacque-Crockett.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: National and international news with reports and analysis from ITV's Correspondents in the UK and around the world as well as the latest major sports results.

programme.title: New: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Grantchester's Tessa Peake-Jones and Rishi Nair drop in on Alan, Mark Addy reflects on his iconic acting roles, and we meet some adorable Border collie puppies.

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Alan shares tips on growing potatoes, Martha Swales delivers a seed sowing masterclass, and Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a pristine Yorkshire garden.

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The latest headlines from around the world at lunchtime with reports and analysis from ITV's Correspondents, all of which are followed by a national weather forecast.

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: Kelly Brook: Prue welcomes the glamorous Kelly Brook into her kitchen and whips up two quiches - a dish that is a Leith firm favourite - from scratch alongside her husband John.

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Romantic musical comedy film starring Meryl Streep and Amanda Seyfried, 2008. A spirited bride-to-be invites her mother's old lovers to her wedding to work out who her father is.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Three sets of friends battle it out in this edition - Marta and Shane from Dursley, Ann and Joyce from West Yorkshire, and David and Sumbul from St Albans and Durham.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Are four celebrities clever enough to take on one of the country's finest quiz brains? Bradley Walsh hosts as Cheryl Baker, Laura Tobin, Jason Bell and Mark Steel face The Chase.

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host the game show where 100 ordinary people from all walks of life are whittled down by playing stupidly simple games with one golden rule - don't come last.

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pine. A runaway train loaded with toxic chemicals will derail in a populated area unless two rail company workers can put their differences aside and to try to prevent catastrophe.

programme.title: Next Level Chef USA
programme.desc: Gordon challenges each of the remaining contestants to create a brunch dish that incorporates both sweet and savoury elements.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of Paula Beer, who is searching the son she gave up for adoption 57 years ago, and Sharon Thomas, who is looking for the younger brother she didn't know existed until she was in her twenties

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern heads to Portsmouth for the game show in which he travels around the UK setting members of the public unusual challenges, giving them the chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the final game.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: More acts audition for a place in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef enjoys recipes from Asma Khan, Ashley Palmer-Watts and Jonny Lake and cooks a dish of his own for former Wham! star Pepsi DeMacque-Crockett

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Tessa Peake-Jones, Rishi Nair and Mark Addy join Alan, and Camilla Basset-Smith shares some colourful springtime planting tips. Susie Parish meets some Border Collie puppies and Andy Clarke shares some spring-inspired cocktail recipes for his Best of British drinks

programme.title: Alan Titchmarsh's Gardening Club
programme.desc: Jason Williams visits a community allotment in Liverpool and Martha Swales shares a seed sowing masterclass. Camilla Bassett-Smith explores a pristine Yorkshire garden and Henry Agg provides a step-by-step guide to building a raised bed. Alan shares his expert advice on growing potatoes and managing ferns

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: The cookery writer and Great British Bake Off judge is joined in the kitchen of her Cotswold home by actress, model and radio host Kelly Brook, who tackles the Italian dish of chicken saltimbocca as the pair discuss love, life and lingerie. Prue prepares a vegetarian curry and gives her tips for some kitchen staples

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Musical romantic comedy featuring the music of Abba, and starring Meryl Streep, Colin Firth and Pierce Brosnan. On an idyllic Greek island, young Sophie Sheridan prepares to marry the man of her dreams. But a problem looks set to blight the big day as the bride doesn't know who her father is. So Sophie sends out invitations to three men who might fit the bill, hoping to solve the riddle once her guests arrive.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which Marta and Shane from Dursley, Ann and Joyce from West Yorkshire and David and Sumbul from St Albans and Durham use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Cheryl Baker, Laura Tobin, Jason Bell and Mark Steel pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host as 100 ordinary people compete in a series of simple games to win a cash prize, all they have to do is not finish in last place. In the first episode, the contestants are tasked with sitting down on an exercise ball whilst blindfolded, successfully stacking a slinky on their forehead without using their hands and balancing a drinks can at a 45-degree angle

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as Olivia Attwood, Jack P Shepherd and Adam Woodyatt compete in a charity edition of the game show, with the three famous faces all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen good causes

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives - with lifelines, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: Protection
programme.desc: Pressure from above threatens Liz's secret investigation as she discovers some disturbing truths which lead her further into the conspiracy.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Ryan Reynolds and Samuel L Jackson. Still smarting from a previous bungled job, security expert Michael Bryce has the chance to redeem himself by delivering hired killer Darius Kincaid to court, to testify against a despot dictator. But there are plenty of people who don't want Kincaid to arrive alive.

programme.title: Romesh Ranganathan's Parents' Evening
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and his mum Penny, Tony Bellew and his son Corey, and Vicky Pattison and her mum Carroll compete in the comedy game show where success lies in the hands of the parents. Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? Expect plenty of surprises that include Romesh's mum Shanthi's method for getting away with murder

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: The cookery writer and Great British Bake Off judge is joined in the kitchen of her Cotswold home by actress, model and radio host Kelly Brook, who tackles the Italian dish of chicken saltimbocca as the pair discuss love, life and lingerie. programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which players Sam and Lisa are presented with clues in the form of answers and must phrase their responses in the form of a question

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Paul from Glasgow, Denise from Hampshire, Louise from Nottingham and Colin from Surrey pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: World Cup Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Latvia (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Ian Wright to present coverage of both teams' second FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier, held at Wembley Stadium. This is the first time these two sides have faced each other, but England will be expecting nothing less than three points against the Latvians, whose only two wins in the last 12 months both came against the Faroe Islands. The English players will be eager to impress Thomas Tuchel in his second game in charge of the country and earn their place in future squads for what are likely to be tougher challenges to come. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Laura Kenny and Krishnan Guru-Murthy answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. If they get stuck, they have four lifelines available, including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: A mutual friend introduces Helen and Alison, and they work out that their former partners must have belonged to a Metropolitan Police squad that infiltrated left-wing groups. No-one is interested in their story and both women are forced to move on with their lives. Seven years later, an online post finally unmasks former officer Mark Kennedy, whose undercover name was Mark Stone

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: Judi's next stop is to the Greek seaside town of Parga where she meets Panayiotis and his family at their baker where she tries a traditional Greek coffee and learns to make feta and olive bread. Father and son duo, Kosmas and Giorgos, teach Judi about the many different uses of olive oil and Elinda takes the comedian on a trip around her herb and fruit gardens. Back on the yacht, Judi makes chargrilled vegetables with halloumi and a chilli mint dressing

programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pine. A runaway train loaded with toxic chemicals will derail in a populated area unless two rail company workers can put their differences aside and to try to prevent catastrophe.

programme.desc: Gordon challenges each of the remaining contestants to create a brunch dish that incorporates both sweet and savoury elements.

programme.title: Mamma Mia!

So Sophie sends out invitations to three men who might fit the bill, hoping to solve the riddle once her guests arrive.

Can Joel overcome his second-place curse, will Tony and Corey's bickering get the better of them, and could Vicky's past party lifestyle lead her and her mum to victory? programme.title: World Cup Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Latvia (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Roy Keane and Ian Wright to present coverage of both teams' second FIFA World Cup Group K qualifier, held at Wembley Stadium. This is the first time these two sides have faced each other, but England will be expecting nothing less than three points against the Latvians, whose only two wins in the last 12 months both came against the Faroe Islands. The English players will be eager to impress Thomas Tuchel in his second game in charge of the country and earn their place in future squads for what are likely to be tougher challenges to come. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pine. A runaway train loaded with toxic chemicals will derail in a populated area unless two rail company workers can put their differences aside and to try to prevent catastrophe.

programme.desc: Gordon challenges each of the remaining contestants to create a brunch dish that incorporates both sweet and savoury elements.

So Sophie sends out invitations to three men who might fit the bill, hoping to solve the riddle once her guests arrive.
